channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban say jail captured and prisoners freed
item.description: Video on social media shows hundreds of inmates leaving the Afghan jail after heavy militant attacks.

item.title: Tokyo attack: Knife-wielding man injures 10 on train
item.description: The suspect allegedly told police he was angry when he saw women who "looked happy".

item.title: China says no more Mao badges after IOC warning
item.description: The Olympic body says it has been told Chinese athletes will no longer wear badges seen as political.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Olympic athletes struggle with heat at Games
item.description: This games are one of the warmest on record, with many athletes complaining about the high temperatures.

item.title: Two arrested over plot to kill Myanmar UN ambassador
item.description: Ambassador Kyaw Moe Tun is a vocal critic of Myanmar's junta, which seized power in a coup on 1 February.

item.title: US to allow visitors from Hong Kong to stay for 18 months
item.description: China reacts angrily to the announcement, which allows thousands to stay in the US for 18 months.

item.title: China: Backlash over marriage question in Olympian's interview
item.description: Chinese athlete Gong Lijiao was asked about her marriage plans and described as a "manly woman".

item.title: Swiss woman found dead in Thailand near waterfall
item.description: Autopsy results are expected Friday after police find a body under a black sheet near a waterfall.

item.title: Indian women's hockey: Sixteen stories of struggle, one tale of triumph
item.description: Fighting until the very end, India go down 3-4 to Great Britain in the bronze medal playoff.

item.title: Australia borders: Citizens living overseas could be 'trapped' if they return
item.description: Australians who live overseas will require exemptions to leave Australia if they return home.

item.title: Amazon: India court rules in favour of online shopping giant
item.description: Both the companies made separate deals with the same Indian retailer - Future Group.

item.title: Sharks from above: Filming 'friendly' encounters in Sydney
item.description: Jason Iggleden captures stunning moments in Sydney, often helping to reduce people's fear.

item.title: China: How Delta threatens a prized zero Covid strategy
item.description: China's battling its widest outbreak since Wuhan - how long can it keep Covid out?

item.title: Article 370: Why more locals in Kashmir are becoming militants
item.description: Two years after India revoked Kashmir's status, more locals are taking up arms in the disputed region.

item.title: How a fake network pushes pro-China propaganda
item.description: The web of 350 fake social media profiles aims to discredit the West, sometimes with garish cartoons.

item.title: 'I donâ€™t want to spend my life on the streets'
item.description: Asma Shaikh, a 17-year-old homeless girl, has big dreams. But the pandemic has brought new challenges.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Bodies on the streets as fighting traps Lashkar Gah residents
item.description: Terrified locals are fleeing if they can as the Taliban and troops battle to control Lashkar Gah.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: Covid vaccine inequity 'completely unacceptable and unethical'
item.description: Rich countries need to do more to give vaccines to poor countries, says top WHO adviser Helen Clark.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chinese nationalists turn on their athletes
item.description: To ultra-nationalists online, losing an Olympic medal is being "unpatriotic", experts say.

item.title: Covid-19: The mystery of rising infections in India's Kerala
item.description: Covid-19 cases continue to rise in Kerala despite the waning of the second wave elsewhere in India.

item.title: Afghanistan: Orphan's reunion with British soldier after 19 years
item.description: Ramin Paikar was among the orphans visited by British soldiers stationed in Kabul in 2002.

item.title: How South Korea's migrant wives are breaking the glass ceiling
item.description: Many arrived not knowing the language, but are now carving out a significant place in society.

item.title: Weightlifter at the centre of sport's transgender debate
item.description: Weightlifter Laurel Hubbard is set to become the first openly transgender athlete to compete in a different gender category to that which they were born at an Olympics.
